item.title: Iraq war
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:19, topic:76588”][quote author=goatee link=topic=112414.msg1138115#msg1138115 date=1176320961]

No, it wasn’t worth it.
We wasted American lives when we should’ve just let Iraq’s tyranny live. That path would’ve killed Iraqis anyhow (only innocent ones, mind you) but hell, it would’ve been cheaper for us. -_-

It wasnt just American lives. America is so self centered.
[/quote]

Didn’t england recently pull the 5 soldiers they had over there out? It has always been mostly americans.[/quote]

Cruel is basically saying the only lives wasted were those of the Americans… saying that all the other soldiers needed to die.

item.title: Iraq war
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

Agreed, but since we didn't the war was necessary. Saddam Hussein was a crazy man who killed thousands of his own people. Since his own people didn't have the balls to stop him, someone had to do it. I enjoyed watching him take 'A long drop with a quick stop' Smiley

Saddam may have killed thousands of his own people, but the CIA sold him the chemical weapons which he used for repression of his population. Not to mention the fact that during the US occupation of Iraq more than half a million innocent civilians have died.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

We entered the Iraqi war for one purpose, to stop terrorism, and by taking Saddam out of power, that was one step in eliminating terrorism, but with there being no visible Nuclear weapons, President Bush as been mocked, and insulted by his peers. If we were to actually get into contact with Osama binladen, without his sheep, and body gaurds, we could take him into custody, or, murder him on the spot. Bush has been made the scapegoat for so many issues, ultimatley, his presidency will be more of a comedy then a Drama.

item.title: Iraq war
item.dc:creator: @Bebemycat2 Bebe
item.description:
@Bebemycat2 wrote:

Of course it isn’t worth it.
It was never worth it.

Not only did we go to war with the wrong country once but twice within 4 years. Yes, I am talking about Afghanistan.
The reason we went to war in Afghanistan is because of 9/11, but if you really look at it, we should have invaded Saudi Arabia.

Osama bin Laden was born in Saudi Arabia. The majority of the 9/11 “hijackers” were Saudis.
But then again you have to look at it from the economic point of view.

Currently Saudi Arabia is estimated to own about 7% of the United States economy, we are talking trillions.
If a war were to happen between them and us, they could easily pull that money pout possibly causing an economic collapse and since most of the world is dependent on the United States economy, it would cause serious disruptions world-round.

I say we should have kept Saddam in power, as he seemed to be the only one who knew how to kept the country “together”.

Also I don’t care how the news stations try to “tip-toe” around it, the “Almighty surge” has failed. The country has fallen into a civil war. It is a lost war, the government needs to realize this and start making decisions that will benefit the people of the world and not just their fat corporate paychecks.

Read full topic
